intro: Hieracium diaphanum, commonly known as the translucent hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and basal leaves that are often lobed or toothed. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Hieracium diaphanum is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
